noExportedImports.description:
Description

Disallow exporting an imported variable.
In JavaScript, you can re-export a variable either by usingexport fromor
by first importing the variable and then exporting it with a regularexport.
You may prefer to use the first approach, as it clearly communicates the intention
to re-export an import, and can make static analysis easier.
noExportedImports.option: This rule has no specific options.
